com.gracenote.gnsdk
Interface IGnAudioSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
GnAudioFile, GnMic
public interface IGnAudioSource

Delegate interface for retrieving audio data from an audio source such as a microphone, audio file or Internet stream. Various Gracenote methods consume audio data via audio sources, allowing the transfer of audio from the audio source to the consumer without requiring the application to manually pass the data. This can simplify the application's implementation. Applications are encouraged to implement their own audio source objects, or example if custom audio file format is used an application may implement an IGnAudioSource interface to the custom audio format decoder.

Method Summary
 long getData(java.nio.ByteBuffer dataBuffer, long dataSize)
          Get audio data from the audio source.

 void sourceClose()
          Close the audio source.
 long sourceInit()
          Initialize the audio source.
 

Method Detail

sourceInit

long sourceInit()
Initialize the audio source. This will be invoked prior to any other methods. If initialization fails return a non-zero value. In this case the consumer will not call any other methods including that to close the audio source.

Returns:
0 indicates initialization was successful, non-zero otherwise.

sourceClose

void sourceClose()
Close the audio source. The consumer will not call any other methods after the source has been closed

samplesPerSecond

long samplesPerSecond()
Return the number of samples per second of the source audio format. Returns zero if called prior to SourceInit.

Returns:
Samples per second

sampleSizeInBits

long sampleSizeInBits()
Return the number of bits in a sample of the source audio format. Returns zero if called prior to SourceInit.

Returns:
Sample size in bits

numberOfChannels

long numberOfChannels()
Return the number of channels of the source audio format. Returns zero if called prior to SourceInit.

Returns:
Number of channels

getData

long getData(java.nio.ByteBuffer dataBuffer,
             long dataSize)
Get audio data from the audio source. This is a blocking call meaning it should not return until there is data available. When data is available this method must copy data to the provided buffer ensuring not to overflow it. The number of bytes copied to the buffer is returned. To signal the audio source is unable to deliver anymore data return zero. The consumer will then stop requesting data and close the audio source.

Parameters:
dataBuffer - [out] Buffer to receive audio data
dataSize - [in] Size in bytes of buffer
Returns:
Number of bytes copied to the buffer. Return zero to indicate no more data can be delivered via the audio source.
